column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1 .
#Text=Introduction
#Text=The seismic resistance of civil engineering structures , especially buildings , is an important aspect related to structural safety in the event of an earthquake .
#Text=Damages to building structures are the most common cause of fatalities due to seismic excitation .
#Text=This applies to structures erected with different technologies .
#Text=Buildings of major importance , such as hospitals , facilities of fire brigades or crisis management centres are designed in accordance with the applicable standards .

#Text=Methods of strengthening these structures , mainly constructed of reinforced concrete or steel frame ( for example using the fiber-reinforced cementitious composite ) , are subjected to many tests , including experimental and numerical ones .

#Text=There are many methods of retrofitting masonry structures , including methods for strengthening cracked walls using high-strength composite materials and a rigid adhesive with low deformability .

#Text=The concept of increasing the effectiveness of secondary structural elements in the overall seismic behaviour of buildings has also been investigated ; for example , the application of special mechanical connectors interposed at the interface between a multi-storey building and the glazing facade .

#Text=The results of the study indicate that , once the input parameters of the connecting devices are properly designed , the glazing facade may work as an effective passive control system for the primary structure .
#Text=An increasing number of newly constructed wooden frame buildings has also been recently observed .
#Text=The technology is popular both in rich and poor countries .
#Text=Properly designed wooden structures are inherently well resistant to dynamic loads , such as extreme earthquakes .
#Text=The current research concerning wooden buildings is focused , among others , on forecasting the occurrence of damage and monitoring the critical structural elements during seismic shocks .
#Text=The research work includes both experimental investigations , including the shaking table tests ( see ) , as well as numerical analyses .

#Text=A number of studies have been focused on structural connectors , anchor connections and special flat bars and angles , the use of which results in stiffening of the whole structure and increasing its seismic resistance .
#Text=The role of connections , with the lateral deformation of the light walls and with q-factor , has also been investigated ( for example , see ) .
#Text=In addition , the low construction cost is one of the most popular and well-known advantages of wooden buildings .

#Text=This is due to the relatively good availability of building material in many parts of the world and ease of assembly related to technical aspects ( heavy equipment is not required ) , as well as assembly time and good usability parameters ( aesthetics , easy repairs and modifications , good climate , etc. ) .
#Text=However , one of the most important technological elements in a wooden frame is the application and proper arrangement of thermal insulation .
#Text=Thermal insulation affects the lifespan and durability of the building , and defines the energy class .
#Text=Unlike other elements of a wooden frame building , the results of research focused on thermal insulation are relatively limited .
#Text=One of a few examples concerns a study on the seismic efficiency of structural insulated panels .
#Text=The behaviour of wood-composite laminated frames under the dynamic loads has also been investigated .

#Text=There are some numerical analyses available , which indicate that thermal insulation of the wooden frame building can substantially affect the dynamic resistance of the whole structure ( for example , see ) .

#Text=The results of these analyses show that using polyurethane foam instead of mineral wool for the in-wall insulation of a wood-frame building leads to an increase in the rigidity of the whole structure .
#Text=This effect is obtained mainly due to full connection between the polyurethane foam and the surrounding wooden elements , and a lack of such connection in the case of mineral wool .

#Text=It has been found that the increase in the rigidity of the building insulated with the polyurethane foam leads to the substantial reduction in the structural response under different seismic excitations .
#Text=It should be added that , in construction , polyurethane foam is known only as an insulation material .
#Text=It turns out that this insulation material can also effectively stiffen the whole structure and improve its dynamic resistance substantially .
#Text=However , the results of the numerical analyses described in have to be verified experimentally .

#Text=Therefore , the aim of the present study is to show the results of experimental tests focused on the dynamic response of wall panels of a wooden frame building with thermal isolation made of traditional mineral wool and polyurethane foam .
#Text=Firstly , the static and the dynamic mechanical analysis ( DMA ) tests were conducted so as to determine the basic thermomechanical properties of the analyzed isolation materials .
#Text=Then , the elements of exterior walls with two types of thermal insulation were tested under harmonic excitation for different amplitudes of displacement .
